text: {{infobox Book | name = Wuthering Heights | title_orig = | translator = | image = Houghton Lowell 1238.5 (A) - Wuthering Heights, 1847.jpg | image_caption = Title page of the first edition | author = Emily Brontë | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United Kingdom | language = English | series = | genre = Novel | publisher = Thomas Cautley Newby | release_date = 1847 | english_release_date = | media_type = Print | pages = | isbn = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} Wuthering Heights is a novel by Emily Brontë. It was first published in 1847 under the pseudonym (false name) "Ellis Bell". After her death, a second edition was edited by her sister Charlotte. The story is about the love of Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw, foster siblings in Yorkshire. It is a classic of English literature, and has been made into movies many times and also a hit song by Kate Bush. == Other websites == * *Wuthering Heights, online text with PDF version. *Reader's Guide to Wuthering Heights *Wuthering Heights voted UK's favourite love story, Guardian Category:1847 books Category:English novels Category:Yorkshire
title: Wuthering Heights
